file_content.text: Ah, Master Jedi--Major Odis P. Valyn, Cell Block Command. Welcome to the eye of the storm.
We'll secure the capacitors until this has blown over. Those Esh-kha aren't going anywhere.
The engineers are safe, and so are your capacitors.
I took care of the Esh-kha.
Outstanding! I'd like to see that Esh-kha rabble try and rig up a starship now!
It would be wise to expect more trouble from that lot.
Those Esh-kha bear watching.
They won't rest until they've spread violence to the farthest reaches.
Those Esh-kha bear watching.
I know persistent enemies when I see them, and these Esh-kha are it.
Keep your eye on those guys.
That bunch of yahoos will run you ragged, you watch.
Keep your eye on those guys.
Thank you for all your help, but I think not. Order and discipline will carry the day, as always.
I am a servant of the people.
You're an example to every man in this outfit. Thank you.
Maybe if you ran a tighter ship, this wouldn't have happened.
No thanks to you.
I see. You'll excuse me if I don't share that opinion. Good day.
Hurry! You've got to free those engineers and secure the capacitors.
Major, a pleasure. Major Odis P. Valyn, Cell Block Command. Welcome to the eye of the storm.
Ah... I'd heard you were around. Major Odis P. Valyn, Cell Block Command. Welcome to the eye of the storm.
We might have chaos outside, but in here, order and discipline rule the day. Let me show you our protocols....
Security breach! Major, the Esh-kha! They seized the capacitor facility!
They what--? Absolutely not!
They just executed four of my maintenance crew!
Take a breath, and tell us what their goal is.
Details... what do they want?
Are you wounded?
I'm fine, I got lucky. But the others... there's so much blood!
Sounds like your well-oiled machine needs an overhaul, Major.
Order and discipline, huh?
Don't just stand there. Report!
They're taking the engineers, and slaughtering everyone else.
The Esh-kha want to use the geothermal capacitors to power a ship and get off the planet. They're interrogating the engineers about how to do it.
Clever buggers... that could actually work.
The Esh-kha can actually rig a ship that way?
They can really do that?
It's complicated, but with the right energy source, yes--those geothermal capacitors could help power a starship.
Enough said. I'm on this.
Good. We have to get those engineers out before the Esh-kha learn how to rig those capacitors.
A bunch of prisoners can't possibly know how to do that.
That sounds like a stretch.
If they force our engineers to cooperate, they can.
If that scum manages to get off this rock...! No, we can't think that way. Discipline!
We have to extract those engineers before the Esh-kha learn how to rig those capacitors. I'm afraid I need your help.
Your engineers will not fall to those animals.
You have it.
These Esh-kha cannot be allowed to spread strife through the galaxy.
You have it.
It's your lucky day; I've seen my share of hostage rescues.
I'm in.
We can't leave those eggheads to die.
Leave it to me.
By the time I'm finished, these Esh-kha will be weeping for their mothers.
I'll bathe in their blood.
I hope you're right.
You'd better bring back the capacitors, too. We'll secure them 'til this... difficulty passes.
You've got to hurry! Those are my guys they're killing!
No way. [Refuse quest]
I see. We'll have to make do somehow. We can't let these animals off Belsavis.
Look around you--order and discipline. That's how we'll win this war.
